title: B2C Marketing Masterplan (Ecommerce | Software | Retail)
blurb:
How to use this playbook
• Work top-to-bottom. Don’t start paid media until Planning is complete.
• Produce the deliverables listed in each step (personas, messaging, budgets, tracking plan, etc.).
• Use the category fit notes for Ecommerce, Software, and Retail.
• Keep a living log: decisions, dates, owners, links to assets.

steps.title: 1) Market & Audience Research (Personas, JTBD, Segments)
steps.goal: Precisely define who you’re targeting, what jobs they hire your product to do, and how to segment them for targeting and messaging.
steps.why: Accurate segmentation drives higher CTR/CVR, lower CAC, and smarter channel choices.
how: How (SOP)
1. Collect internal data (2–5 days)
o GA4: Demographics, Interests, Paths (Explore), Conversions.
o Ecommerce/CRM: AOV, repeat rate, products per order, cohort retention.
o Social: Instagram/TikTok/YouTube audience insights.
o App (if Software): App Store Console / Google Play Console acquisition & retention.
2. Market intel (2–7 days)
o Category size, growth, seasonality, pricing norms, competitors.
o Identify direct, indirect, and substitute competitors.
3. Qualitative research (5–10 interviews, 10–15 mins each)
o Jobs-to-Be-Done interviews: pains, desired outcomes, previous solutions, purchase triggers, anxieties.
4. Quantitative survey (n≥200)
o Validate pains, barriers, motivations, willingness to pay, preferred channels.
5. Build personas (3–5)
o Include: photo/name, demo/psycho, goals, pains, triggers, objections, preferred channels, sample copy.
6. Segment into targetable groups
o Map to platform targeting (interests, lookalikes, keywords, geos).
7. Output & sign-off
o Personas PDF, JTBD summary, targetable segments list, channel fit per persona.
steps.notes:
Category fit
• Ecommerce: heavy use of GA4 + Hotjar + Meta/TikTok insights.
• Software: add Mixpanel, App Store/Play data, LinkedIn insights.
• Retail: GA4 + GBP (Google Business Profile) insights + store footfall data (Placense, Cubiq).

steps.title: 2) Competitive & Channel Gap Analysis
steps.goal: Find SEO, backlink, PPC, creative, affiliate, and pricing gaps you can exploit.
how: How (SOP)
1. Identify 5–10 top competitors (direct and substitute).
2. SEO gap
o Keyword gap, content gap, SERP features, schema usage.
3. Backlink gap
o Sites linking to competitors but not to you; PR angles; digital PR targets.
4. Paid search & Shopping
o Brand vs non-brand coverage, ad copy angles, extensions, Shopping feed quality.
5. Paid social & creative
o Hooks, formats, UGC, creator styles, offer positioning.
6. Affiliate/Influencer
o Networks used, top partners, coupon sites, creator types.
7. Pricing & offer
o Discounting cadence, bundles, subscriptions, BNPL, guarantees.
8. Channel priority score
o Score channels 1–5 on audience fit, cost, CPC/CPM, intent, speed, complexity.
steps.notes:
Category fit
• Ecommerce: SEO, Shopping, Meta/TikTok creative, affiliate.
• Software: SEO + Google/YouTube/LinkedIn; less coupon affiliates, more content partners.
• Retail: Local SEO, Maps ads, Meta ads, price benchmarking.

steps.title: 3) Brand & Messaging System (Positioning, Tone, Visual Identity)
steps.goal: Codify who you are and how you communicate.
how: How (SOP)
1. Positioning statement:
"For [audience], [brand] is the [frame of reference] that [benefit], because [proof]."
2. Messaging house
o UVP, 3–5 benefit pillars, supporting proof (stats, social proof, guarantees).
3. Tone & voice
o 5 adjectives (e.g., friendly, authoritative, witty, premium, playful).
o Do/Don’t examples (write 5 examples for emails/ads).
4. Visual identity
o Logos, color palette, typography, imagery style, icons, motion rules.
5. Asset templates
o Email header/footer, social post templates, ad templates (1:1, 4:5, 9:16, 16:9), landing page blocks.
6. Centralize in a Brand Kit (shareable, versioned).

steps.title: 4) Funnel & Channel Strategy (Awareness → Conversion → Retention)
steps.goal: Match channels to funnel stages and to your category.
how: How (SOP)
1. Map funnel: Awareness, Consideration, Conversion, Retention, Advocacy.
2. Assign channels per stage (see table below).
3. Define role of each channel (e.g., Meta = demand creation; Search = capture intent).
4. Set testing plan: 70% proven, 20% optimization, 10% experiments.
Channel-to-Category Priority Matrix
Channel	Ecommerce	Software (B2C app/consumer SaaS)	Retail
SEO (content+PLP/PDP)	★★★★	★★★★	★★★
Google Search/Shopping	★★★★★	★★★★	★★★★ (Local Inventory Ads)
Performance Max	★★★★★	★★★	★★★★
YouTube Ads	★★★	★★★★	★★
TikTok Ads	★★★★★	★★★	★★★★
Pinterest Ads	★★★★ (lifestyle)	★★	★★★
Snapchat	★★★	★★	★★★
LinkedIn Ads	★	★★ (if prosumers)	★
Influencer/UGC	★★★★★	★★★	★★★★
Affiliate	★★★★★	★★	★★★
Marketplaces & Retail Media	★★★★★	—	★★★★
Local SEO/GBP	★★	★	★★★★★
(★ = relevance/priority)

steps.title: 5) Offers, Pricing & Conversion Readiness
steps.goal: Define irresistible offers and ensure site/app can convert.
how: How (SOP)
1. Offer strategy: discounts, bundles, gifts, free shipping threshold, subscriptions, trials, guarantees.
2. Pricing guardrails: floor price, MAP, promo calendar, stackability rules.
3. Conversion readiness:
o Speed & CWV, mobile UX, clear USP above the fold, social proof, reviews, FAQs, risk-reversal (returns/guarantees), payment methods (Apple/Google Pay, BNPL).
4. Legal & compliance: privacy policy, cookie consent, data retention rules.

steps.title: 6) Tech Stack, Tracking Plan & Data Governance
steps.goal: Implement reliable tracking, data model, and naming conventions before launch.
how: How (SOP)
1. Tagging: Set up Google Tag Manager; define events (e.g., view_item, add_to_cart, begin_checkout, purchase; sign_up/subscribe for Software).
2. GA4: Enhanced Ecommerce (Ecommerce), conversions (Software: trial_start, activated_user).
3. Server-side tagging (recommended): GTM Server-Side (Stape/Google Cloud).
4. Attribution: ad platform pixels (Meta, TikTok, Google), consent mode v2, CAPI (Meta), Events API (TikTok).
5. Naming conventions (critical):
o CHANNEL_OBJ_SEGMENT_AUDIENCE_OFFER_CREATIVE_VARIANT_DATE
o UTM: utm_source, utm_medium, utm_campaign, utm_content, utm_term with a maintained dictionary.
6. Data governance: single source of truth, data owner, QA checklist, change log.

steps.title: 7) Budgeting, Forecasting & Prioritization
steps.goal: Allocate budget by channel, forecast outcomes, and stage rollouts.
how: How (SOP)
1. Top-down guardrails: % of revenue (B2C typically 7–12%).
2. Bottom-up forecast: CPC/CPM, CTR, CVR, AOV, margin → CAC, ROAS, MER.
3. Phasing: Month 1–3 (validation), Month 4–6 (scale), Month 7+ (optimization/MMM).
4. Experimentation: 10–15% budget for tests (new channels, creatives, offers).
5. Pacing & caps: daily/weekly pacing rules, CPA/ROAS guardrails.
deliverables: Test plan (hypothesis, KPI, sample size, duration)

steps.title: 8) SEO (Technical, Content, Authority)
how: How (SOP)
A. Technical SEO (weeks 1–4, then ongoing)
• Crawl with Screaming Frog/Sitebulb; fix 4xx/5xx, redirects, canonicals.
• Indexation: robots.txt, XML sitemaps, noindex where needed (facets).
• Core Web Vitals: LCP, INP, CLS fixes (image formats, lazy load, script defers).
• Structured data: Product, Breadcrumb, Organization, FAQ; validate with Rich Results Test.
• Ecommerce specifics: faceted navigation, variant handling, pagination (rel=”next/prev” alternatives), internal linking from PLP→PDP.
• Retail: Local pages per store, NAP consistency, embedded GBP.
• Software: Docs/knowledge base SEO, comparison pages, “best apps for X”.
B. Keyword Research & Mapping
• Gather seed terms, competitor terms; cluster by intent (info → transactional).
• Map to pages: category (PLP) / product (PDP) / blog / comparison / support.
• Prioritize by volume, difficulty, business value.
C. On-Page & Content
• Title/H1/H2, meta, internal links, schema; content briefs with entities (NLP).
• Editorial calendar: 2–4 cornerstone guides + 6–12 supporting posts/quarter.
• Product content: unique descriptions, review markup, UGC Q&A.
D. Authority (Links & PR)
• Digital PR campaigns (data stories, trend reports), HARO/Connectively pitches.
• Partnerships, resource page link building, creator collaborations.
steps.notes: KPIs: Indexed pages, CWV pass rate, rankings by cluster, organic sessions, revenue, assisted conversions, link velocity.

steps.title: 9) Paid Search, Shopping & PMax
steps.goal: Capture demand profitably and scale with automation.
how: How (SOP)
1. Account structure
o Campaigns by intent: Brand, Non-Brand High Intent, Competitor, Generic, Shopping, PMax, Local (Retail), App (Software).
2. Feeds & Shopping (Ecommerce/Retail)
o Clean titles, GTIN/MPN, rich attributes, image quality, promotions; manage in GMC.
3. Bidding
o Start Maximize Conversions (learning) → move to tCPA/tROAS once stable.
4. Negatives & query sculpting
o Add negatives weekly; funnel queries to best campaigns.
5. Ads & assets
o RSA with pinning for control, sitelinks, callouts, structured snippets, call extensions (Retail).
6. Performance Max
o Separate by product margin/tier; feed-only PMax for control; add audience signals; high-quality creatives.
7. Local & calls (Retail)
o Local campaigns, Local Inventory Ads, call ads during open hours with call tracking.
8. Bing/Microsoft Ads
o Import from Google; run where Bing share ≥5% or older demographics.
steps.notes: KPIs: CPA/ROAS by intent, Search Impression Share, CTR, CVR, MER (blended), new vs returning revenue.

steps.title: 10) Paid Social (Meta, TikTok, Pinterest, Snap, Reddit, YouTube)
steps.goal: Create demand and convert with thumb-stopping creative.
how: How (SOP)
1. Structure
o Separate Prospecting vs Retargeting; Advantage+ Shopping (Meta) for Ecommerce; Spark Ads on TikTok.
2. Audiences
o Broad + LALs (1–5%) + interests; intent stacks for retargeting (viewed, added to cart, video views).
3. Creative system
o UGC hooks: problem-solution, before/after, 3 reasons why, stitch reactions (TikTok).
o Design specs: 1:1 and 4:5 (Meta), 9:16 (TikTok/Snap).
o Creative testing loop: 3–5 new ads/week; kill < X CTR or > Y CPA.
4. Offers
o Bundle/BOGO, free ship threshold, time-bound promos, risk-reversal.
5. Measurement
o Use platform + GA4; run geo-tests or MTA where possible; holdouts if scale.
steps.notes: KPIs: Thumb-stop rate/video watch, CTR, CPC, CAC/ROAS, assisted conversions, creative fatigue time.

steps.title: 11) Email, SMS & Lifecycle Automation
steps.goal: Monetize traffic, increase LTV, and reduce CAC via retention.
how: How (SOP)
1. List growth
o Pop-ups (10–20% discount), quiz lead magnets, giveaways; capture SMS consent.
2. Deliverability
o Authenticate (SPF/DKIM/DMARC/BIMI), warm IP/domain, list hygiene.
3. Core flows
o Welcome (3–5 emails): brand story → social proof → first offer.
o Browse abandonment (2–3): viewed items; soft nudge → social proof.
o Cart abandonment (2–4): urgency, testimonials, incentive ladder.
o Post-purchase: order updates → usage tips → review/UCG request → cross-sell.
o Win-back (90 days idle): new arrivals + incentive.
4. Campaigns
o Weekly/bi-weekly, segmented by RFM, category interest, AOV tier.
5. SMS
o Short, timely: drop alerts, back-in-stock, shipping updates.
6. Segmentation
o RFM tiers, interests, lifecycle stage, purchase frequency, discount sensitivity.
7. Testing
o Subject lines, send time, creative, offer; monitor spam signals.
steps.notes: KPIs: List growth, deliverability (inbox, spam), OR, CTR, CTOR, CVR, revenue per send, unsubscribe rate, LTV.

steps.title: 12) Affiliate, Partnerships & Influencers
steps.goal: Acquire customers via third-party partners with CPA-aligned economics.
how: How (SOP)
1. Choose model: % of sale, fixed CPA, tiered CPA, bounties for first purchase.
2. Network selection: based on niche, geos, publisher mix.
3. Recruit: top coupon/content sites, niche blogs, creators; give assets, product seeding, custom codes.
4. Compliance: terms, brand guidelines, FTC disclosures, coupon leakage control.
5. Optimize: prune low-quality partners, bonus top partners, exclusive drops.
steps.notes: KPIs: EPC, CPA, ROAS, incrementality (use on/off tests), fraud rate.

steps.title: 13) Marketplaces & Retail Media (Ecommerce/Retail)
steps.goal: Win incremental demand on Amazon/Walmart/Instacart and drive store sales.
how: How (SOP)
• Catalog & content: SEO’d titles, bullets, A+ Content, videos, reviews.
• Ads: Sponsored Products/Brands/Display; dayparting and placement bid adjustments.
• Retail media: Walmart Connect, Instacart Ads, Target Roundel.
• Ops: stock, Buy Box, pricing parity, FBA/SFP, reviews velocity.
steps.notes: KPIs: Organic rank, ad TACOS, Buy Box %, OOS rate, review rating/velocity.

steps.title: 14) CRO & On-Site Personalization
steps.goal: Lift conversion rates and AOV systematically.
how: How (SOP)
1. Research: analytics funnels, heatmaps, session replays, form analytics, VOC.
2. Hypotheses: prioritize with PIE (Potential, Importance, Ease) or ICE.
3. Testing: A/B with minimum sample size; pre-register hypotheses.
4. Personalization: product recommendations, geo banners, lifecycle messaging.
steps.notes: KPIs: CVR, AOV, PDP→Cart rate, Checkout completion, test win rate, incremental revenue.

steps.title: 15) PR, Community & Word of Mouth
steps.goal: Earned media and advocacy to reduce blended CAC.
how: How (SOP)
• PR: seasonal stories, data reports, product launches; pitch journalists with tailored angles.
• Community: Discord/Facebook Groups; run AMAs, challenges, member-only drops.
• Referral: double-sided incentives, milestone rewards.
steps.notes: KPIs: Referral rate, earned reach, backlinks, share of voice.

steps.title: 16) KPIs & Targets (Define success per channel)
how: Executive (blended): Revenue, MER (Rev/Spend), Contribution Margin after ad spend, CAC, LTV, payback period.
SEO: Non-brand sessions, ranking coverage by cluster, clicks/impressions (GSC), revenue.
PPC: CPA/ROAS by intent, Impression Share, Search Lost IS (budget), New vs Returning revenue.
Paid Social: CTR, view-through, CAC/ROAS, creative hold time, new-to-brand %.
Email/SMS: Deliverability, OR, CTR, Rev/Send, flow vs campaign split, unsubscribe.
Affiliate: EPC, incremental sales %, fraud rate.
Marketplace: TACOS, organic rank, Buy Box %, OOS rate.
CRO: Test velocity, win rate, uplift, AOV, funnel step CVRs.
Set cadences:
• Daily health checks; Weekly channel reviews; Monthly strategy; Quarterly planning.

steps.title: 17) Data Pipeline & Power BI Architecture
steps.goal: One dashboard showing keywords, leads/orders, spend, and revenue.
how: Data sources
• GA4 (web/app), GSC (SEO), Google Ads/Microsoft Ads, Meta/TikTok/Pinterest, Email (Klaviyo etc.), CRM/ecomm (Shopify, Stripe, Recharge), Affiliate network, Marketplaces, CallRail.
Ingestion options
• Connectors: Supermetrics, Funnel.io, Windsor.ai (fast), Fivetran/Stitch (to warehouse).
• Warehouse (recommended at scale): BigQuery, Snowflake, Redshift.
• Direct to Power BI: native connectors + scheduled refresh + on-prem gateway (if needed).
Model (Star schema)
• Facts: ad_spend, sessions, orders, revenue, email_sends, affiliate_conversions.
• Dims: date, channel, campaign, adset/audience, creative, product, geo, device, persona.
• Keys: consistent campaign IDs and UTMs across platforms.
Power BI build (SOP)
1. Dataflows for each source (or import from warehouse views).
2. Transform with Power Query: normalize column names, types, currencies, time zones.
3. Relationships: link facts to dims on surrogate keys; create a Date table.
4. DAX measures:
o ROAS = [Revenue]/[Ad Spend]
o MER = [Revenue Total]/[Ad Spend Total]
o Blended CAC = [Ad Spend Total]/[New Customers]
o LTV 90d/180d/365d (from cohort fact).
5. Dashboards:
o Exec Overview (MER, Revenue, Profit, CAC, LTV, ROAS trend).
o Channel Deep Dives (Search/Social/Email).
o Creative Board (ad spend by hook/format, performance).
o SEO Board (rank buckets, clicks, revenue).
o Cohorts (by acquisition month, by channel).
6. Refresh: schedule daily; alerting for failures.
7. QA: reconcile platform vs GA4 vs orders weekly; log variances.
Governance & QA
• UTM policy, naming dictionary, access control, PII handling, data retention schedule.
• Anomaly detection (simple): control charts or thresholds with email alerts.

steps.title: 18) Reporting SOPs & Meeting Rhythm
how: Daily: spend pacing vs plan, site uptime, OOS, major swings.
Weekly (60–90m): channel reports, learnings, next tests; share creative insights.
Monthly: performance vs targets, budget re-allocation, roadmap.
Quarterly: strategy reset, pricing/offers, new channels, MMM refresh.
Templates
• 1-pager per channel (KPIs, wins, losses, actions).
• Test tracker (hypothesis, design, dates, outcome).
• Budget vs actuals.

steps.title: Appendices (grab-and-go) + Quick Tool Index
how: A) Naming & UTM Convention (example)
• Campaign: META_CONV_PROSPECTING_LAL1_VISUALS30_OFF_UGC_V1_2025-08
• UTMs
o utm_source=facebook utm_medium=paid_social
o utm_campaign=conv_prospecting_lal1_visuals30_off_ugc_v1
o utm_content=hook_problem_solution_v2
o utm_term= (use for search keywords only)
B) Launch Checklist (abbreviated)
• Personas, JTBD, segments approved
• Messaging house & brand book done
• Tracking plan implemented & QA passed
• UTM/naming dictionary shared
• Site speed ≥ CWV pass; key CRO fixes live
• Budget & forecast approved; tests defined
• Initial creatives produced (per platform spec)
• Email flows activated (welcome, browse, cart, post-purchase)
• Dashboards connected; refresh scheduled
